definition: to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost/same as 鞠躬盡瘁|鞠躬尽瘁[ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4]
to bend to a task and spare no effort unto one's dying day (idiom); striving to the utmost one's whole life/with every breath in one's body, unto one's dying day
pinyin: ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4 , si3 er2 hou4 yi3

sentences.english: It is a charge to keep and I will give it my all.
sentences.chinese: 它是一項要履行的職責，我將爲此鞠躬盡瘁。

sentences.english: His voice was perfectly calm and confident.
sentences.chinese: 屠維嶽鞠躬，非常鎮定非常自信地回答。

sentences.english: At the end of the statement, Mr To bowed in apology.
sentences.chinese: 發表聲明後，涂謹申鞠躬道歉。

sentences.english: Cavorting pairs bow gracefully to each other.
sentences.chinese: 跳躍的伴侶，優雅地相互鞠躬。

sentences.english: The little tailor stepped up and bowed.
Premier Zhou En- lai worked hard all his life in behalf of the Chinese revolution.
sentences.chinese: 周恩來總理畢生爲中國革命鞠躬盡瘁。

sentences.english: He stood up and bowed to Wang in a show of remorse.
sentences.chinese: 他站起來向王夏虹鞠躬表示自責。

sentences.english: It stopped near the edge of the pool and bowed.
sentences.chinese: 它在水池邊附近停下，然後彎腰鞠躬。

sentences.english: Time to bow to our new overlords, The Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 是時候向我們新國王鞠躬了，這些中國人。

sentences.english: The Japanese women salute the people with formal bows in welcome.
sentences.chinese: 這些日本婦女以正式的鞠躬向人們施禮以示歡迎。

sentences.english: Jean Valjean accepted the sou with a deep bow.
sentences.chinese: 冉阿讓收下這個蘇，總深深地一鞠躬。

sentences.english: Jolyon rose and made a slight bow .
sentences.chinese: 喬裏恩站起來微微一鞠躬。

sentences.english: They bowed to the king with all due submission.
sentences.chinese: 他們必恭必敬地向國王鞠躬。

sentences.english: In Korea, men bow slightly and shake hands to greet each other.
sentences.chinese: 在韓國，男人見面時微微鞠躬並握手來互致問候。

definition: to send one's greetings/to send best regards/to devote attention to
expression of gratitude/to give thanks/a thank-you note/acknowledgement
to say hello to/to send one's regards to
to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
to bow with hands held in front
to half rise out of one's chair (a polite gesture)
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to kneel/to go down on one's knees
